Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of chloroquine as a solution to COVID-19, stating that it can completely cure any infection of the virus.
Understate: The claim understates the potential risks and limitations of using chloroquine as a treatment, as it fails to mention the high treatment failures and drug resistance associated with the drug.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient scientific evidence or support to prove the effectiveness of chloroquine as a solution to COVID-19.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the use of chloroquine as a treatment for malaria in Africa automatically translates to its effectiveness against COVID-19.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or treatments for COVID-19, and presents chloroquine as the only solution.
